panels.description: The checkpoints mark the last block a stage can recover from in the case of a crash or shutdown of the node
panels.title: Stage checkpoints
Sync progress (stage progress as highest block number reached)

panels.description: The average commit time for database transactions. Generally, this should not be a limiting factor in syncing.
panels.title: Average commit time

panels.description: The size of tables in the database
panels.title: Database tables

panels.description: The size of the database over time
panels.title: Database growth

panels.description:
The type of the pages in the database:

- **Leaf** pages contain KV pairs.
- **Branch** pages contain information about keys in the leaf pages
- **Overflow** pages store large values and should generally be avoided if possible
panels.title: Database pages

panels.description:
The amount of gas processed by the execution stage in millions per second.

Note: For mainnet, the block range 2,383,397-2,620,384 will be slow because of the 2016 DoS attack.
panels.title: Gas processed

panels.description: The number of tracked peers in the discovery modules (dnsdisc and discv4)
panels.title: Discovery: Tracked peers

panels.description: The number of incoming and outgoing connections, as well as the number of peers we are currently connected to. Outgoing and incoming connections also count peers we are trying to connect to.
panels.title: Connections

panels.description: Internal errors in the P2P module. These are expected to happen from time to time. High error rates should not cause alarm if the node is peering otherwise.
panels.title: P2P errors

panels.description: Internal errors in the header downloader. These are expected to happen from time to time.
panels.title: Errors

panels.description: The number of connected peers and in-progress requests for headers.
panels.title: Requests

panels.description: The internal state of the headers downloader: the number of downloaded headers, and the number of headers sent to the header stage.
panels.title: I/O

panels.description: Internal errors in the bodies downloader. These are expected to happen from time to time.
panels.title: Errors

panels.description: The number of connected peers and in-progress requests for bodies.
panels.title: Requests

panels.description: The number of blocks and size in bytes of those blocks
panels.title: Downloader buffer
